catalogue_raissonne:
Masterpieces from the Japanese painting collection of the Minneapolis Institute of Art
ミネアポリス美術館 日本絵画の名品 Cat.41
creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: 3/4 view of a woman in sumptuous kimono, holding and displaying skirt in PR hand; kimono decorated with koi fish and water plants, with folds and lines that resemble ripples in a pond; elaborate hair adornment; pink upper lip, green lower lip; red lacquer roller ends
markings: LLC, red square intaglio artist seals: 襄 {Jō} | 陵 {Ryō}
medium: Hanging scroll; ink and color on silk
title: Beauty with Carp Kimono
